decision_conditions: The oak tree is located in the front garden of 77 Ladygate Lane. It is a mature tree, is in good condition and has a large attractive crown. The tree is situated in a prominent position along Ladygate Lane and significantly contributes to the street scene and arboreal character of the area. These factors ensure that the tree has a high amenity value.

This application has been refused on the grounds of two main points. Firstly, based on the level monitoring results, the ground movement can be managed by undertaking crown reduction work. The ground movement is currently under 15mm which would suggest that felling the tree may be premature, and crown reduction work may be more appropriate at this stage.
